description:
'''Dong Young-bae''' ({{Korean|hangul=동영배}}; born May 18, 1988), better known by his stage name '''Taeyang''' ({{Korean|hangul=태양|labels=no|lit=sun}}) or '''SOL''', is a South Korean singer. He made his debut in 2006 as a member of the South Korean [[boy band]] [[BigBang (South Korean band)|BigBang]]. Following the release of several albums and extended plays with his group, Taeyang pursued a solo career in 2008, releasing his first [[extended play]], ''[[Hot (Taeyang EP)|Hot]]''. The EP was acclaimed by critics and went to win the award for Best R&B & Soul Album at the 6th [[Korean Music Awards]]. ''Hot'' was followed by his first full-length studio album ''[[Solar (Taeyang album)|Solar]]'' (2010), which was released in July 2010 and peaked atop the [[Circle Album Chart|Gaon Album Chart]].

Taeyang's second studio album ''[[Rise (Taeyang album)|Rise]]'' (2014) peaked at number 112 on the [[Billboard 200|US ''Billboard'' 200]], becoming the highest ranking album by a Korean soloist in the chart, while its lead single, "[[Eyes, Nose, Lips]]", peaked at number one on the [[K-pop Hot 100|''Billboard'' K-pop Hot 100]]. "Eyes, Nose, Lips" was one of the most popular songs in South Korea during 2014 and was awarded Song of the Year at the [[MAMA Awards]], [[Melon Music Awards]] and [[Golden Disc Awards]]. His third studio album, ''[[White Night (album)|White Night]]'', released in 2017, debuted at number one on the ''Billboard''{{'}}s [[Billboard charts#Albums|World Digital Albums]] and remained atop for two weeks, making Taeyang the second solo K-pop artist to have an album do so. Taeyang's vocal skills have been admired by music critics and he is regarded as one of the best vocalists in South Korea.
